forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 57. West southwest wind around 10 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 63 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 7 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a veil of clouds hangs softly in the sky, promising a daytime contrast that will warm both heart and spirit. The morning carries the gentle embrace of maritime air, cool yet refreshing, as a light breeze stirs around 10 mph, playfully rustling the trees. The forecast hints at a transition as the sun ascends—this afternoon, expect the clouds to yield to azure skies, with temperatures climbing to a comfortable 65 degrees, nudging into the softness of late summer.

While the fog momentarily holds its ground, especially around the Golden Gate, its presence is a reminder of the city’s unique charm. The elusive marine layer may appear now, but as the sun takes over, it will retreat, revealing a landscape that feels both polished and alive. For the day's adventures, a light sweater or long-sleeve shirt would serve well during the cooler morning and afternoon breezes, giving way to a more casual, comfortable outfit as warmth envelops the city. 

Consider a stroll along the Embarcadero, where the bay breeze mingles with the vivid humanity of San Francisco. Or perhaps a visit to one of the many cafes, where you can sip a tranquil cup of coffee and watch the city wake as life unfolds around you. This is a day for connection—both with the city and those around you—reminding us of the simple pleasures that make every moment worth savoring.
